Reference

vegaspec

The central object of this package is vegaspec, an S3 object which inherits from list. Use these functions to coerce to a vegaspec, format as JSON, or otherwise operate on a vegaspec. If the V8 package is installed, you can translate a Vega-Lite specification to a Vega specification.

as_vegaspec()

Coerce to vegaspec

vw_as_json()

Coerce vegaspec to JSON

vw_autosize()

Autosize vegaspec

vw_to_vega()

Convert to Vega specification

vw_spec_version()

Determine vegaspec version

Rendering vegaspecs

The central side-effect of this package is to render a vegawidget, an S3 object which inherits from htmlwidget. A vegawidget is built using a vegaspec. A helper function is provided for vega-embed options. These options can be specified as an argument to the vegawidget function, or as an R option, vega.embed, which would picked up by the knit_print method. If the webshot package and PhantomJS are installed, knitting to a non-html format should “just work”.

vegawidget()

Create a Vega/Vega-Lite htmlwidget

vega_embed()

Vega embed options

knit_print.vegaspec()

Knit-print method

Shiny

Some basic functionality is provided now; more is on the way.

renderVegawidget()

Render shiny-output for vegawidget

vegawidgetOutput()

Shiny-output for vegawidget

Data

These are sample specifications.

spec_mtcars

Example vegaspec: mtcars scatterplot

Images

If you have the webdriver package and PhantomJS installed, you can convert and write a vegaspec or a vegawidget to PNG or SVG format.

vw_to_png()

Convert to PNG data-URI string

vw_to_svg()

Convert to SVG string

vw_write_png()

Write to PNG file

vw_write_svg()

Write to SVG file

vw_png_bin()

Coerce data-URI string to raw binary

Debugging and sharing

These are functions to help you understand a vegaspec and to help you share your work with others. The examine function requires that you have the listviewer package installed. The functions to create and retrieve blocks use the gistr and fs packages, also the webdriver package and PhantomJS if you want upload images to your block.

vw_examine()

Examine vegaspec

vw_create_block() vw_create_block_gistid()

Create gist to use as block

vw_retrieve_block()

Retrieve vegaspec from block

Utilities and internal functions

These functions help you determine the version of your vegaspec, the versions of the JavaScript libraries used to render your vegawidget, and to create a block. You will likely not need to call any of the “block” functions directly.

vw_spec_version()

Determine vegaspec version

vega_version()

Determine Vega JavaScript versions

vw_block_index()

Create text for block index.html

vw_block_build_directory()

Build block-directory

vw_block_config()

Specify block-configuration
